div.a: Grab and Go for April 20 and 23

span.p: North Harrison Schools Food Distribution will take place on Monday, April 20 and Thursday, April 23 from 5:30pm to 6:30pm.

This is FREE for all students of North Harrison and Morgan. Free means free! You must complete this form in order to receive these meals. Please fill out the form by 11:00am on Sunday to sign up for food pick up Monday and/or Thursday so that we can plan for the week. This form is sent Friday of each week for meal pick-up for the following week. Please sign up by 11:00am on Sunday.

The form allows you to select Monday and/or Thursday as pick up days. You may select one or both days. The deadline to sign up for both days is each Sunday at 11:00 AM. If you have any questions, please send an email to kchinn@nhcs.k12.in.us
A huge thank you to Uhl Truck Sales for allowing us to use a refrigerated truck. Without their help this would not be possible.
Please create a sign with your children's names for display on the front dash of your car for meal pick up. This speeds up the process dramatically.
Due to federal guidelines for reimbursement this event will be located at Morgan Elementary at the front entrance.
I hope this letter finds you well.

All of our offices remain available for emails and phone calls. If you need something from one of the schools or central office, do not hesitate to email or call. While our school buildings remain closed it does not mean that learning is not taking place. I could not be more proud of the effort our teachers, parents, and students have made in this awkward transition. When Governor Holcomb closed schools, our entire school community rose to the occasion. I am not saying it is perfect, but I am saying that it is not for a lack of effort. The creativity, engagement, and passion than I am seeing makes me even prouder to be a part of North Harrison Community Schools.

We have three Continuous Learning days with two waiver days each week. Our last assignments will be given the week of May 11 – 15. Students will need to have all of their work completed on or before May 20th. Teachers will be finalizing their end of year grades on May 22nd. Our buildings continue to send grade-level specific guidance via Harmony. Please make sure you are receiving that important information.
Please click HERE to read the rest of Dr. Richard's letter.

Due to the current COVID-19 restrictions, Morgan Elementary and North Harrison Elementary will gather kindergarten registrations for the 2020-21 school year electronically. Children who will turn 5 years of age on or before August 1, 2020, are eligible to register.
Click HERE to access the Registration Form.

Parents should plan to locate immunization records and a birth certificate for their children. According to State of Indiana regulations, immunization records must be up-to-date prior to a child’s entrance into school. Birth certificates must be provided no later than 30 days after the beginning of the school year.

All current North Harrison Elementary and Morgan Elementary students, including current preschool students, are automatically registered for the 2020-21 school year. Please contact our school offices with any questions you may have. We will be monitoring our phone calls even during our present closure. The number at Morgan is 812-364-6138, and at North Harrison Elementary it is 812-347-2419. We are looking forward to welcoming our new kindergarten students to our school!

div.a: Harrison County FREE Public Wi-Fi Locations

span.p: There are MANY locations in Harrison County that are offering FREE Wi-Fi. Click here to look at the list of locations.
Click HERE to see the full-size version of the Resources.

We know that we are in unprecedented times where technology is at the forefront of your student's education. We understand that this is a trying time for all of you at home as you are needing to help your students with their classwork; however, we also know you may be unsure how to help due to the digital platform that is being used to reach your student. Hopefully, the information posted below will help you understand so you are able to help your student if needed.
